fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-349].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
It is currently not possible to change the issue type on Service Desks. All fields are editable except *Issue Type*, which is greyed out.

!request.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow to modify *Issue Type* and possibly provide option to apply to existing requests or only for new requests
 
h3. Workaround 
# Remove and/or add a new *Request Type* with the desired *Issue Type*.
(!) This step will remove an existing *Request Type* without migrating all the issues to a new *Request Type* resulting in _No Match_ for the *Customer Request Type* on the issue and the issue will not be searchable on the Issue Navigator if we use search using the *Customer Request Type* field.
# If you would like to migrate a *Request Type* to a new *Issue Type* and make sure all the existing issues to be still searchable using *Customer Request Type* field:
## You can hide the current request type.
## Then, create a new request type with the new issue type using the same Request name and place it on the Customer Portal.
fields.summary: As an admin I want to be able to change the Issue Type for an existing Service Desk Request Type

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Closed Access Service Desks with {{sd.use.search.by.permissions}} feature flag set (default), might have slow user picker search. 
see KB for more details: [Closed Access Service Desks, slow user picker search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=935389758]

h3. Environment
* a large number of users 10k+ 
* The dark feature {{sd.use.search.by.permissions.disabled}} is not activated.
* Closed Access ServiceDesks
** Who can raise requests?  set to _Customers who are added to the project_.

h3. Expected Results
User picker search is fast and doesn't have extra memory/SQL pressure 

h3. Actual Results
User picker search can be slow and have extra memory (see JSDSERVER-5958)/SQL pressure 
 
h3. Notes
* In case of _Closed_ Servicedesk, code takes users by permission and does additional filtering.  Unfortunately, increased memory consumption (and interoperability with lazy user cache) wasn't taken into account.
* Overall disabling of this feature flag doesn't affect search results but has an effect on performance. With it disabled open and closed servicedesk will go through the same execution path. 

h3. Workaround
* Disable "sd.use.search.by.permissions" feature flag, see KB [Closed Access Service Desks, slow user picker search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=935389758]
fields.summary: ServiceDesk sd.use.search.by.permissions feature flag might cause slow user picker search

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
High memory usage for _Closed_ Service Desk projects with Group _Anyone_ permission

h3. Environment
* Instance with a large number of users (100K+)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create ServiceDesk project with following settings:
#* ServiceDesk access permission:  _Closed_
 #** we can check by running /rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/<PRJ>/settings/requestsecurity
 !SD_perm.png|thumbnail!
 #* ServiceDesk project permission:  add Group *Anyone* (which is almost equal to Open SD)
 !SD_Perm_pr.png|thumbnail!
# trigger the REST call [/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/sd-user-search/participants?issueKey=SDPRJ-2&query=admin]

h3. Expected Results
Low memory allocated by Service Desk thread

h3. Actual Results
High memory allocated by Service Desk thread (1GB+), which may lead to heavy JVM memory pressure and OOM
 
h3. Notes
* When servicedesk is closed and _"sd.use.search.by.permissions"_ feature flag is enabled it load ALL the customers into the memory and then filters them.
** hit the {{com.atlassian.jira.security.type.GroupDropdown.getUsers()}}  which calls {{com.atlassian.jira.user.UserUtils.getAllUsers()}}
 * KB which we have related to this [Closed Access Service Desks, slow user picker search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=935389758]

h3.Workaround
* Disable "sd.use.search.by.permissions" feature flag, see KB 
* Remove Group *Anyone* and make project _Open_
fields.summary: High memory usage for Closed Service Desk projects with Group Anyone permission

fields.description:
We are evaluating Jira Service Desk and have a service desk workflow where customers often submit the same requests again and again, but with slightly different data in the fields (e.g., changing dates, titles, etc). To date this is done by emailing in a fairly long Excel template, and our user research has indicated customers often keep around the last few Excel files they submitted to use as starting points for the next request they submit.

For JSD to have a viable UX for our use-case, we would need customers to be able to look through their "My Requests" section on the portal and clone an issue to save time on the next submission. This doesn't appear to be a feature at this time, but has interest from others as seen here: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Desk-questions/How-can-my-customers-clone-an-oft-used-issue-in-the-JSD-Customer/qaq-p/88518
fields.summary: Allow customers to clone an issue from the customer portal

fields.description:
{panel}

Disable empty JQL queries 	

Allows you to choose how an empty JQL query behaves: either returning no results at all (ON), or all existing issues (OFF). We've introduced this option to avoid performance issues with empty filters returning all existing issues in your instance.

Note that some plugins may be using empty JQL queries to return all issues on purpose. Turning on this option will affect them. An empty JQL query in Queues, SLAs and Reports within JIRA Service Desk will continue to return all issues per project.

Default: OFF  

{panel}

Notice it doesn't talk about automation. Setting Project = ProjectKey seems to workaround this issue for projects.
fields.summary: JSD automations query does not limit to project, Disable empty JQL queries set to ON breaks automation.

fields.description:
The [Cloud version of the Managing the Email Channel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/managing-the-email-channel-732528949.html] document outlines options that are available to configure. These include Strip Quotes, Parse HTML Emails, etc.

Server also offers these options, however [the Server documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver/managing-the-email-channel-939926306.html] does not list these options. Customers could be misled into believing these are Cloud-only configuration options. 

An ideal update for the Server version of this document would explicitly list each option and a description of what it does. See the Cloud version of the document as an example. 

In JSD 3.9, the options are:
 * Strip Quotes
 * HTML email parsing
 * Public email comments
 * Customer account creation

Attached is a screenshot from JSD 3.9.6 showing 4 different configurable options.

!image-2018-07-27-16-12-21-700.png!
fields.summary: Improve option clarity on Managing the Email Channel

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
SLA Completed cycles calculation is slow due to multiple calls to GoalMatcher#getMatchingGoal with the same params

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project with a few SLA configurations
# Viewing an issue having as few as 3 configured SLAs is sufficient to replicate slowness

h3. Expected Results
SLA calculations don't slow down issue view significantly

h3. Actual Results
* Both {{GET /rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/sla/issue/}} and {{GET /browse/IT-6}} requests are considerably slowed down
* SLA calculations are bottlenecked in the following:
{code}
at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.goal.GoalMatcherImpl.findMatchingGoal(GoalMatcherImpl.java:58)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.goal.GoalMatcherImpl.getMatchingGoal(GoalMatcherImpl.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.goal.GoalCalculationServiceImpl.getCalculatorFromTimeMetric(GoalCalculationServiceImpl.java:153)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.goal.GoalCalculationServiceImpl.getRemainingTimeUnitsForCompletedGoal(GoalCalculationServiceImpl.java:108)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.goal.view.GoalViewServiceImpl.getCompleteInformation(GoalViewServiceImpl.java:403)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.goal.view.GoalViewServiceImpl.generatePreviousCyclesList(GoalViewServiceImpl.java:248)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.goal.view.GoalViewServiceImpl.getLatestCompleteCycleViewInformation(GoalViewServiceImpl.java:173)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.goal.view.GoalViewServiceImpl.getDetailedViewData(GoalViewServiceImpl.java:137)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.sla.goal.view.GoalViewServiceImpl.getGoalDataForDetailView(GoalViewServiceImpl.java:114)
{code}
Which can be seen from thread dumps
 
h3. Notes
* getMatchingGoal params are issue and time metric, during of generation of SLA details this method called for each completed cycle for each metric, this gives a lot of redundant calls with the same params. In a  support case with only 3 SLAs valid for the issue, calculation of SLA details results in 66 calls to getMatchingGoal, which ideally can be reduced to 3 calls.
* getMatchingGoal itself is a heavy operation as it executes temporary reindex of the issue and jql match
* This same bottleneck slows down the workload report significantly

h3.Workaround
There is no known workaround for this issue
fields.summary: SLA Completed cycles calculation is slow due to multiple calls to GoalMatcher#getMatchingGoal with the same params

fields.description:
Some customers may wish to utilise a read only service desk (where customers cannot raise issues) and have agents raise issues to be shared with various organisations.

This is currently possible to implement now (by removing the "Create Issue" from the "Customer Portal Access" group - although you'll run into [this bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-5922]).

Even if the bug were to be fixed, the portal isn't necessarily designed for a read only state. It'd be great to be able to mark a Service Desk Project as a "Read Only for Customers" project, which would cover a number of things:

# When you remove the "Customer Portal Access" group from the Create Issue Permission, Jira will alert you saying that the permission scheme has errors (but it's perfectly valid for this use case)
# The portal view should let users know that they can't create a request, but can see requests shared with them or their organisations (and link to the appropriate views)
# The portal view should also make it clearer that if they do need to raise a request, they can visit the other help desks in the system (and should refer them back to the list of Service Desks).
fields.summary: Provide better support for "announcement" service desks that are read only

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
Currently when [Configuring service desk notifications | https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/configuring-service-desk-notifications-732528936.html]Depending on the chosen *"When"* Trigger event Option Selected Different *Choose recipients* options become available for the To option when sending an email, BUT there is no mention of which is available under each option only noting:
{quote}
Choose recipients
Add at least one of the following to the To field:

|| Recipient options | Details ||
| Reporter (customer) | The reporter of the request. This notification is sent even if the reporter has opted out of receiving notifications on the customer portal. |
| Customers involved | All customers involved on the request, including the reporter and request participants. This notification is not sent to customers if they have turned off notifications for an individual request in the portal or a request's email thread. |
| Added participants | The people who have been added as request participants.
Added organizations The people in an organization that the request has been shared with. |
| Approvers | The people who need to approve or decline a request. |
| Exclude person who caused the action | Prevents the person who triggered the rule from receiving a notification. For example, if a customer adds a comment to a request, you can choose to exclude them so they don't receive a notification about their own comment.|
{quote}

As an EXE:
If you Choose: "WHEN=Status Changed" for the THEN Send Email *"TO"* Field only has the options *"Reporter (Customer)"* & *"Customers Involved"* available

h3. Suggested Solution
Add information to available Choose recipients options per Trigger event
 
h3.Current Options:
|| Trigger | Available Recipient options ||
| A Linked Issue is Transitioned | Reporter (customer), Customers Involved |
| Approval Complete | Reporter (customer), Customers Involved |
| Approval Required | Reporter (customer), Approvers, Customers Involved |
| Comment Added | Reporter (customer), Customers Involved |
| Comment Edited | Reporter (customer), Customers Involved |
| Issue Created | Reporter (customer), Customers Involved |
| Issue Resolution Changed | Reporter (customer), Customers Involved |
| Organization added to issue | Reporter (customer), Customers Involved, Added Organizations |
| Participant Added to Issue | Reporter (customer), Added Participant, Customers Involved |
| SLA Time Remaining | Reporter (customer), Customers Involved |
| Status Changed | Reporter (customer), Customers Involved |
| Time In Status | Reporter (customer), Customers Involved |

h3. Additional Note:

(!) There is also a limitation for the recipients to which an email can be sent by the "Send Email" action in the automation rules. We should specify it in the documentation [Automating your Service Desk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver0314/automating-your-service-desk-954240116.html]

 !Automation_SendEmailRule.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Provide Clarification on available Choose recipients options

fields.description:
h3.Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a new basic Service Desk Project (using all the defaults provided in a fresh installation)
# Create a customer, and assign that customer to an organisation called "Everyone"
# As an Admin/Agent, create a request via the "Raise a Request" control on the sidebar (so the issue is visible in the portal)
# Once the issue has been created, share it with Everyone
# Log in as your Customer in a private window - verify they can see the request the agent created under "My Requests" when the "Created By" dropdown is set to "SHARED WITH MY ORGANISZATIONS" or "Everyone"
# As an Admin, Remove the "Create Issues" permission from "Service desk customer - portal access"
# As the customer, refresh the requests screen - and the request shared with the organisation is no longer visible.

h3.Use Case
A customer might wish to use Service Desk for Announcements, and thus want a read-only-for-customers style desk, with which they can share requests with all customers. The need to have the "Create Issues" permission to simply _view_ issues in a list seems incongruous and is confusing. Not having the "Create Issues" permission doesn't stop the Customer from viewing the issue directly - just from seeing it under "My Requests".
fields.summary: Removing the "Create Issues" permission for Customers prevents them from seeing requests in the portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Service Desk doesn't respect external user management setting when sending account verification email.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable [External user management|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/configuring-jira-application-options-935391821.html] option
# Create a dummy user in AD
# Connect JIRA to AD directory with Read-Only permission
# Create a new Organisation and then Add Customer there.
# JIRA will send an invitation to the respective user.

h3. Expected Results
User doesn't need to change / reset his password once he gets the link.

h3. Actual Results
User tried to reset password and gets the following error:
{code}
The password could not be changed by the credentials provider. com.atlassian.crowd.exception.OperationNotPermittedException: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.ApplicationPermissionException: Not allowed to update user 'john2' in directory 'Active Directory server'.
{code}

h3.Workaround

Upgrade Service Desk to 3.10.0 or higher, and suppress welcome email by enabling "Do not sent account verification email" on Project settings > Customer notifications page.

(!) Note that this workaround only applies to the activation email sent to customers via the button Customers > Add Customer. It does not apply to the agent activation email sent via the "Invite Team" button, since such emails are not disabled with the setting "Do not sent account verification email".
fields.summary: Service Desk doesn't respect external user management setting when sending account verification email.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Trying to retrieve issues reported by a a +customer+ user using Jira Servicedesk  REST api.
 It looks like its not possible to retrieve all issues using the REST api.



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Find a customer user that has reported thousands of issues using customer portal
# Run the REST call like this : {{<baseURL>/rest/servicedeskapi/request?start=0&limit=100}} {{<baseURL>/rest/servicedeskapi/request?start=0&limit=100}} {{<baseURL>/rest/servicedeskapi/request?start=100&limit=100}} {{<baseURL>/rest/servicedeskapi/request?start=200&limit=100}} {{<baseURL>/rest/servicedeskapi/request?start=300&limit=100}}
# but the api is only returning few hundred issues, not all of them even when there are thousands of issues reported by the customer.

h3. Notes
Since the REST api has another known bug : https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4187, as a workaround tried to run the REST call like this :
# {{<baseURL>/rest/servicedeskapi/request?start=0&limit=100}} {{<baseURL>/rest/servicedeskapi/request?start=0&limit=100}} {{<baseURL>/rest/servicedeskapi/request?start=50&limit=100}} {{<baseURL>/rest/servicedeskapi/request?start=100&limit=100}} {{<baseURL>/rest/servicedeskapi/request?start=150&limit=100}}

h3. Expected Results
It is possible to retrieve all the issues reported by the customer.

h3. Actual Results
It is not possible to retrieve all the issues using the REST api.


h3.Workaround
There is no workaround available as of now :(
fields.summary: Running Servicedesk REST api to GET all requests posted by a customer does not fetch all issues

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Problem definition
The "Created by me" filter on the portal's Requests page is showing only requests which the reporter is the current user but not necessarily created by the current user (creator). This is confusing as _Reporter_ and _Creator_ are different fields in Jira and this should be used consistently in any Jira applications.

h5. Suggestion
Change the filter name to "Reported by me" or something along those lines or provide users to change these filter names as they would like to.

h5. Note
This should also apply to the "Created by anyone" filter.
fields.summary: Change the "Created by me" filter name

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Summary of behavior:*

The customer page can be slow to load the list of customers if the background search for agents does not complete in a timely manner.
 * When loading the customer page, JIRA Service Desk will search for agents so that agents can be excluded from the list of customers.

Contributing Factors:
 * +JIRA instance has hundreds or thousands of users with agent license+
 * Agents are members of many nested groups
 * Customer Organizations are enabled (always enabled in JSD 3.3 and newer)

Explanation of delay:
 * JSD gets a list of groups that give agent permission
 * Checks each user in each group to make sure they are active and that they have application access
 ** The number of agents in the instance directly relates to the number of users that will be searched. More agents result in more users being searched, causing a longer delay.
 * The check for application access retrieves group membership for the user, including nested group membership.
 ** The search of nested groups can cause the search to take longer than it would otherwise.

*Steps to reproduce:*
 * Create JIRA Service Desk instance with 1000s of agents who are members of multiple nested groups
 * Attempt to load customers page
 ** Observe delay
 ** Compare with JSD 3.2 which did not perform this agent search when loading customer page.

Example stacktrace:
{noformat}
"http-nio-8080-exec-19 url:/rest/servicedesk/1/pages...arch username:username " #296 daemon prio=5 tid=0x00007f4f70008800 nid=0x1bef0 runnable [0x00007f3ff7bf7000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.util.LinkedHashMap.afterNodeInsertion(LinkedHashMap.java:299)
	at java.util.HashMap.putVal(HashMap.java:664)
	at java.util.HashMap.put(HashMap.java:612)
	at java.util.HashSet.add(HashSet.java:220)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.RemoteDirectorySearcher.findNestedGroupMembershipsIncludingGroups(RemoteDirectorySearcher.java:316)

...

	at scalaz.$bslash$div.map(Either.scala:111)

{noformat}
*Workaround*

*Agents may add customers and search for customers without waiting for the customer list to load.*

Methods to reduce the delay include:
 * Reduce number of agents in instance
 * Discontinue use of nested groups, or reduce amount of nesting so search will be quicker.
fields.summary: Customers page loads slowly due to slow agent search

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 24 March 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}

Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this issue.

After investigating this request further, we believe it has been incorrectly categorised as a feature suggestion rather than a bug. Jira Service Management notifications are currently not respecting the [global Jira setting for ‘email from’|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-jira-application-options-938847824.html#ConfiguringJiraapplicationoptions-settingsGeneralsettings].

We understand that this issue can cause confusion for your customers and it is an issue we would like to resolve. Thank you for your votes and comments on this ticket, it has surfaced it for our attention.

The related public bug ticket ([JSDSERVER-3597|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3597]) will be reopened and triaged accordingly - please follow progress on that ticket.

Kind regards,

Charlie

Jira Service Management, Server & Data Center{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Jira service desk portal notification is using a different notification header that uses in Jira notification.
h4. *Jira Service Desk Portal notification*

!service desk notification email.jpg|thumbnail!
h4. *Jira notification*
!jira notification email.png|thumbnail! 

Jira notification email is using an *Email from* settings from Jira General configuration:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

It will be better if service desk notification will follow the same template settings while sending email notification.
fields.summary: Allow Jira Service Desk portal notification to use an Email Settings from Jira General Configurationn

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, it's not possible to have a different Customer Portal URL from JIRA's Base URL without customizations:
* [Make it possible to use service desk in combination with subdomains|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-513]
* [Create ability to customize the Customer Portal URL in JIRA ServiceDesk|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1627]

Even when customizations are done, SDS email notifications still use JIRA's Base URL instead of the customized Portal URL, causing confusion to customers (especially those without access to JIRA's Base URL).

h3. Suggestion
When implementing the above 2 features, take into account the usage of Portal URL in SDS email notifications.
fields.summary: SDS email notifications should use Customer Portal URL instead of JIRA's Base URL

h5. Problem definition
If the date time picker custom field is empty, the current date and time will be shown as the value in the portal request view and the value is real-time.

h5. Steps to reproduce the issue
# Create a custom field of date time picker type and add it to the issue type screen.
# Add the field to the request form but leave it optional.
# Create the request *without* selecting a value on the date time custom field.

h5. Expected result
The custom field will not appear on the created request because it has no value.

h5. Actual result
The custom field appears on the created request with the current date and time (and keep updating) as the value.
* On the Agent's view of the issue, the custom field does not appear because it has no value in the issue.

h5. Workaround
Configure a default value for the custom field e.g. the current date and time option to reduce the occurrence of this bug

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The current [Approvals search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/advanced-searching-fields-reference-780868130.html#Advancedsearching-fieldsreference-ApprovalsApprovals] that is available for advanced JQL queries allows to search for requests that are waiting for approval (by using "Approvals = pending()").

The problem is that this search does not catch requests that are not yet transitioned to the status that requires approval. It only catches requests that are already pending approvals. For example, if a request is created and has an approval status but hasn't yet reached this status, the query "Approvals = pending()" won't work. Therefore it is not possible to use the Approvals search to filter such requests.
h3. Suggested

Add a new function to the Approvals search to catch such tickets.
h3. Workaround

The issues that are in before approvals stage could potentially be found using the STATUS field, provided the workflow is set up in a way that is coupled with the pre-approval stages. Example query
{code:java}
Approvals = pending() OR Status in (X, Y, Z){code}
 

Optionally, the query could also be narrowed down to only show issue or request types that have Approvals in them.
fields.summary: Provide a way to look for requests that have an approval status, but which are not yet pending for approval

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

Some customers want to integrate Service Desk with a Confluence knowledge base, and with the following configuration:
 - The Confluence Server is only reachable from an internal network
 - The Service Desk Server is publicly reachable from the internet

With such configuration:
 - if Service Desk is accessed from the internal network, KBs can be searched and their content can also be opened from Service Desk.
 - however, if Service Desk is accessed from outside the internal network, KBs can be searched but their content can't be loaded within Service Desk.

The reason why the KB search works fine in Service Desk regardless of where the customer is accessing Service Desk from is because, in case of the search results, JIRA prefetches the results of the query via API call made to a Confluence endpoint (server side). The browser just retrieves the results from JIRA not directly from confluence as with the Confluence page view.

However, for the loading of the KB page, what happens is that JIRA doesn't fetch the page's content by API, it actually just loads the Confluence page by an HTML <iframe>. So in this scenario it's the location of the browser that matters and not the location of JIRA.
h3. Suggested Solution

Use the API to pre-fetch the Confluence KB articles, rather than embed the actual confluence web doc/page directly in an iframe on the client side.
h3. Workaround

For now the only workaround that we can suggest is to make the Confluence server publicly open to the internet, or if there is any confidential information, create 2 Confluence instances:
 - one instance that is used internally and that is only reachable from the internal network
 - one instance which is reachable from the internet, used to serve KBs in Service Desk
fields.summary: Allow knowledge base pages to be loaded in Service Desk when Confluence is only reachable from an internal network

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When you create an email channel for the first time, Service Desk will let you know if the mailbox contains mail - which is great.

However, if you're simply updating a password *with no other changes* then Service Desk should not check for mails in the inbox - because for an existing server, Service Desk would have gotten to do the "There's no mails in the box" initial check.

If any other details change, then Service Desk should do the check (because it's a new server, and we should verify that server). 

Working around this becomes difficult - there are three options:

# Move mails in the inbox to a different folder, update the account, then move the mails back
# Connect with IMAP, wait for the mails to be processed, then swap over to IMAP
# Update the connection settings in the database (as per the workaround in [JSDSERVER-5778|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-5778])
fields.summary: When only updating the password for an Email Channel, Service Desk shouldn't care about emails in the inbox

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When searching for uses in the *Invite team* dialog, it is possible to cause high memory pressure inside the JVM, which can lead to outages and an {{OutOfMemoryError}}. This should only happen when there's a large number (10K+) of agents.

h3. Environment
* Jira Service Desk 3.9.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a large amount of users, for example, 10000 or more.
# Create a Service Desk project.
# Add all users to the project role *Service Desk Team*.
# Click on *Invite team* and type several characters. For example, type 'user' then delete all characters, then type 'user' again. Repeat this operation a few times.

h3. Expected Results
Jira does not allocate a large amount of memory and there are no performance issues.

h3. Actual Results
A large amount of memory, possibly related to user caches, is loaded in the heap (see JRASERVER-67502). Every keystroke makes an HTTP request, so there will be multiple HTTP threads allocating a large amount of memory. This can turn the instance unresponsive due to repeated full GC operations and can eventually lead to an {{OutOfMemoryError}}.

h3.Workaround
Disable the module responsible by the *Invite team* functionality, following these steps:
# Go to *Administration > Add-ons > Manage add-ons*;
# Select *All add-ons* on the right of the filter box just above the list of add-ons;
# Type in "service desk project" in the filter;
# Expand the view of the only plugin that should be displayed under the "Application Components" section, named *JIRA Service Desk Project Plugin*;
# Click to expand its list of modules where it says "75 of 75 modules enabled";
# Disable the following module:
#* Invite team (sd-project-sidebar-invite-team)

Adding agents is still possible by manually adding them to the *Service Desk Team* role under *Project settings > Users and roles*.
fields.summary: Searching for users in the 'Invite team' dialog can lead to memory pressure and OutOfMemoryError in some situations

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if you attempt to visit a Service Desk customer portal during a full lock and reindex you'll a receive a 500 error in the UI with decidedly not-user-friendly stack track. Partial trace below, full stack attached:
{code:none}
com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.SearchUnavailableException at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.getEntitySearcher(DefaultIndexManager.java:878) at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.getIssueSearcher(DefaultIndexManager.java:858) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498) at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:22) at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy12.getIssueSearcher(Unknown Source) at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.SearchProviderFactoryImpl.getSearcher(SearchProviderFactoryImpl.java:18) at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.getIssueSearcher(LuceneSearchProvider.java:148) at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.searchCount(LuceneSearchProvider.java:117) at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.search.DefaultSearchService.searchCount(DefaultSearchService.java:121) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at 
{code}

In logs we see the same exception preceded by a 30-second timeout exception ({{com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.IndexException: Wait attempt timed out - waited 30000 milliseconds}}), also attached in full.

h3. Suggested Solution

Jira provides a user-friendly error indicating that a full index is occurring and thus the instance is not reachable. A similarly user-friendly message should be provided when visiting the customer portal during a full reindex.

h3. Why this is important

The 500 error is confusing to users and can drive internal support tickets.
fields.summary: Provide user-friendly error when loading customer portal during a full lock and reindex

{"helpCenterBranding":{"headerBGColor":"","headerLinkColor":"","headerLinkHoverColor":"","headerLinkHoverBGColor":"","logoUrl":"","logoId":"","helpCenterTitle":"Welcome to the Help Center","sharedPortalName":"Help Center","translations":{"en-US":{"helpCenterTitle":"Welcome to the Help Center","sharedPortalName":"Help Center","localeDisplayName":"English (United States) [Default]"}},"siteDefaultLanguageTag":"en-US","userLanguageTag":"en-US"},"portal"
[...]
{code}

fields.description:
Currently, when our Service Desk technicians / agents login to the Service Desk customer portal, there is nothing they can click to switch to the Agent view and view their work Queues.

i.e. If you are currently viewing a service desk such as [https://jira.example.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/1] there is nothing you can click that will take you to [https://jira.example.com/projects/PROJECT/queues/custom/1] or even [https://jira.example.com|https://jira.example.com/]

 

If there already is a way to do this, I couldn't find it, so it's not obvious or intuitive.

 

Instead, we currently need to train our Service Desk technicians to edit the URL in their web browser to navigate between the Service Desk portal ([https://jira.example.com/servicedesk] ) and JIRA's regular interface ([https://jira.example.com|https://jira.example.com/] ) for managing issues in the Projects.

 

It would be nice if there was a link or shortcut in the top of the Service Desk banner that, if you have a Service Desk Agent license (Service Desk application access), you can click to go to the Agent view.  And similarly a link in the left sidebar of the Project to go directly to the customer portal from the regular Jira view.
fields.summary: Provide an easy way to switch between Portal view and JIRA/Agent view

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion
As part of compliance with GDPR, organizations need to guarantee that users agree to the privacy policy set by the organization. A suggestion would be to include a checkbox option during customer signup. As an example:

This ticket can be closed.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In Jira Service Desk Server 3.4.1 an SLA Audit Log was introduced for troubleshooting SLAs. This audit log can grow to huge sizes in the database, so a cleanup job was introduced(https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-5266). This cleanup job helps to keep the size of the database tables smaller, but can still allow the audit log to grow to large sizes and the job itself can become very resource intensive and long running. This leads to a performance impact due to the SQL query used and a stability impact because the query can become long running(over 30 hours has been seen) and can block other database calls.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a dark feature, or other configurable parameter, to completely disable the SLA Audit Log.
h3. Why this is important

The tradeoff between the benefits of the SLA Audit Log and the impact it can create is something that may vary from instance to instance and should be configurable to best fit the use case for that instance.
 This is important because admins should be given the choice of whether to use the audit log feature or not.
h3. Workaround

 
 The closest thing to a workaround is to set a configuration setting in the database to reduce the number of days before an audit event is cleaned up. The default is 30 days and this can allow the tables to get too large, slowing down the cleanup job. If we reduce this to 1 day the tables will be kept much smaller and because they are smaller the cleanup job is able to complete much more quickly.

The database property is:
 sd.sla.audit.log.cleanup.days

Run the SQL query to determine the ID of the property in the database:
{code:java}
SELECT * FROM propertyentry JOIN propertynumber ON propertyentry.ID=propertynumber.ID WHERE PROPERTY_KEY = "sd.sla.audit.log.cleanup.days";
{code}
Then to modify this parameter from 30 to 1:
{code:java}
UPDATE propertynumber SET propertyvalue=1 WHERE ID = <ID from above>;
{code}
Related tickets:
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-5266
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-5719
fields.summary: As a Service Desk Admin I would like to be able to disable the SLA Audit Log so that I can improve performance and stability of Jira Service Desk Server

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

It is currently possible to pause the SLA by using the assignee field based, on the 2 following events:
- "Assignee: Set"
- "Assignee: Not Set"
 !SLA_PausedOn.png|thumbnail! 

However, it is not possible to decide to pause the SLA or not based on the value of the Assignee field.

Here is an example of use case:
- Let's say that 5 teams are working in support
- Each team has their own SLA
- When a ticket is assigned to group A, the SLA of group A should tick, and the SLA of the other groups should pause
- When this ticket re-assigned to another group (say group B), the SLA of group B should tick, and the SLA of the other groups (including group A) should pause


h3. Suggested Solution

Add more events to the SLA configuration page to pause the SLA based on the value of the assignee field.

h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Add the ability to configure the SLA to pause based on the assignee field

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary
* Validation for Project role 'Administrators' does not consider upper case: when an admin access an SD project, SD validates if the role ‘Administrators' exist, if it doesn’t, it warns the user !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! and then gives a button to fix the issue. The issue is that if the role exists but in upper case ('ADMINISTRATORS'), the warning is shown, and when the button to fix the issue is pressed an error is shown indicating that the Administrators role already exist.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
* Make sure the project role ADMINISTRATORS exist (in upper case).
* Access an SD project with an admin user.

h5. Expected Behavior
* No error is shown.

h5. Actual Behavior
* An error is shown indicating that the role Administrators does not exist.
* If the user tries to fix the problem using the button _Upgrade Permission scheme_ an error is shown indicating that the role Administrators already exists  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Cause
* Aparrently a difference in the validation that checks if the role exists vs the validation done when creating the project role.

h5. Workaround
* Rename the role *ADMINISTRATORS* to *Administrators*.
fields.summary: Validation for Project role 'Administrators' does not consider upper case.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Feature Request Background

The mail stripping functionality ("Strip Quotes" setting) uses some quite sophisticated algorithm to detect quoted email.

It can detect markers to cut email (such as the dashed line marker, and the "Write replies above" marker). It can also detect patterns as described in the feature request JSDSERVER-466. Some examples of patterns are:

*From To block*
{code:java}
From: Admin <admin@example.com>
Sent: Thursday, June 18, 2015 12:29 AM
To: Ronald
Subject: Keyboard doesn't work
{code}
*On date, someone wrote*
{code:java}
On Tue, Jun 9, 2015 at 5:33 PM, Admin <test@gmail.com> wrote:

> Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia
> and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. Separated they live in
> Bookmarksgrove
{code}
*On date, wrote someone*
{code:java}
Am 11. Juni 2015 um 10:23 schrieb Admin <test@gmail.com>:

> Ver ver weg, achter het woord bergen, ver van de landen Vokalia en
> Consonantia, daar leven de blinde teksten. Gescheiden leven ze in
> Bookmarksgrove
{code}
*Original Message*
{code:java}
----- Original Message -----
>From: Admin <test@example.com>
>To: "test@gmail.com" <test@gmail.com> 
>Date: 2015/6/12, Fri 10:49
{code}
*Forwarded Message*
{code:java}
-------- Forwarded Message --------
Subject:   Fwd: Thunderbird 31 hello 2
Date:  Thu, 11 Jun 2015 10:21:07 +0700
{code}
*Begin forwarded message*
{code:java}
> Begin forwarded message:
>
> From: Admin <test@example.com>
> Subject: [jira@localhost] [DEVONE] request 2004 [DEV-72]
> Date: June 10, 2015 at 2:27:01 PM GMT+7
{code}
*Sent from my iPhone/iPad*
{code:java}
Sent from my iPhone/iPad

> On 22-06-2015, at 14:58, Admin <test@example.com> wrote:
>
> hello
{code}
*Date, someone:*
{code:java}
2015-06-11 14:04 GMT+07:00 Admin <test@example.com>:

> Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia
> and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. Separated they live in
> Bookmarksgrove right at the coast of the Semantics, a large language ocean.
>
{code}
h3. Problem definition

Depending on the pattern that is used to detect quoted emails, for some of them only English is supported, and for the other ones English and a few more languages (like French, German, Spanish, Japanese) are supported.

For example, the "From/Sent/To/Subject/CC" can only be detected in English. If this block is in a different language (such as Swedish), it won't be stripped:
{code:java}
Från: Customer User <customer@gmail.com> 
Skickat: den 11 juni 2014 12:10
Till: Customer Support <customersupport@gmail.com>
Ämne: Please help
{code}
h3. Suggested Solution

Support more languages for the patterns used by the email stripping functionality
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Support more languages for the patterns used by the email stripping functionality

h3. Summary

Transition loads indefinitely if the user making the transition loses visibility of the issue (Browse Project Permission) after the transition.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Implement a permission scheme whereby only the current assignee (User_A) of the issue has Browse Project Permission.
* Navigate to the Service Desk project's queue view and select a project.
* Perform a transition.
** On the transition screen, ensure that the assignee field is shown.
** Change the assignee to another user (User_B).
** Click on transition button.
(i) This causes the current assignee to lose Browse Project Permission.

h3. Expected Results
* Transition screen popup disappears.
* User_A cannot view the issue (because user_A does not have Browse Project permission).

h3. Actual Results
* Transition loads indefinitely [^screenshot-1.png].
* User_A is unable to view the issue.
fields.summary: Transition loads indefinitely if the user loses browse project permission after the transition

No workaround.

fields.description:
Hi,

I believe there is a gap with your current SLA configuration capabilities. The options to specify a start trigger for the SLA do not include a change in PRIORITY, and it is the most common scenario to have different SLA times based on different priorities.

Currenlty, if you have an issue with P1 = 4hours SLA, the SLA will start counting down from 4 to 0. However, if you update the priority of the issue to P0 = 1hour SLA, nothing will happen to the SLA.

I believe it is indeed very needed to enhance the start triggers to allow for condition 'Priority' changes and the appropriate follow-up options to update the SLA.
fields.summary: Add Priority Change as a trigger in the SLA start conditions
